Package com.saguaro.controller

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.saguaro.controller.UserController
  • @RestController
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
    REST controller defining endpoints related to user management. The following endpoints are defined:
    • login
    • register
    • logout
    Author:
    Charles Wong

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      UserController​(UserService userService)
      Constructs this user controller given a UserService.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserController

        public UserController​(UserService userService)
        Constructs this user controller given a UserService.

        Notice that by default, Spring will attempt to autowire the only constructor of a class.

        Parameters:
        userService - a UserService to provide logic for this controller

    • Method Detail

      • login

        @PostMapping("/login")
public User login​(@RequestParam("username")
                  java.lang.String username,
                  @RequestParam("password")
                  java.lang.String password)
           throws InvalidLoginException
        Given a string username and password, attempts to authenticate a client. If successful, the corresponding User object is returned, which can be serialized into a JSON object containing the following properties:
        • id
        • name
        • username
        • roles
        • token

        If the provided username does not exist, or the password does not match the username, then the login operation is unsuccessful and an InvalidLoginException is thrown.

        A new token is provided on every successful login, and any prior tokens are invalidated; at most one token will be valid for a user at any given time. Tokens are non-expiring.

        Parameters:
        username - a String username to authenticate
        password - a String password to authenticate
        Returns:
        the User that was successfully authenticated
        Throws:
        InvalidLoginException - if the login operation was unsuccessful

      • register

        @PostMapping("/register")
public User register​(@Validated(com.saguaro.controller.UserController.RegisterGroup.class) @RequestBody
                     com.saguaro.controller.UserController.UserPayload payload)
              throws InvalidParamException
        Register a new user with Saguaro given a valid RegisterPayload. A valid payload must include the following fields:
        • name
        • username
        • password
        All fields must not be blank; they must be non-null and contain at least one non-whitespace character. Invalid payloads will cause an InvalidParamException to be thrown.

        On successful registration, the newly created User object is returned. Note that registering a user does not log them in; the object returned will have a null token attribute.

        Parameters:
        payload - a RegisterPayload containing information about the user to register
        Returns:
        the User that was registered
        Throws:
        InvalidParamException - if an invalid RegisterPayload was provided
        See Also:
        UserController.UserPayload

      • logout

        @PostMapping("/logout")
@ResponseStatus(NO_CONTENT)
public void logout()
        Logout an authenticated user. This endpoint is a protected resource, meaning that a valid token must have been provided in an Authorization header to reach this method. On successful logout, that token will be invalidated.

      • editUser

        @PutMapping("/api/edit-user")
public User editUser​(@Validated(com.saguaro.controller.UserController.EditGroup.class) @RequestBody
                     com.saguaro.controller.UserController.UserPayload payload)
        Given a valid UserPayload, replaced the logged-in user's attributes with any non-null attributes of the payload. Note that a user's username cannot be changed; the username property of the payload is ignored by this method.
        Parameters:
        payload - the UserPayload containing user attributes to change
        Returns:
        the newly saved User object

      • addFriend

        @PostMapping("api/add-friend")
public User addFriend​(@RequestParam("username")
                      java.lang.String friendUsername)
               throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Given a username, add that user as a friend of the currently authenticated user.

        If the provided username to add as a friend does not exist, a ResourceNotFoundException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        friendUsername - the String username of the user to add as a friend
        Returns:
        the newly modified User object
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the given username to add as a friend does not exist

      • removeFriend

        @DeleteMapping("api/remove-friend")
public User removeFriend​(@RequestParam("username")
                         java.lang.String friendUsername)
                  throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Given a username, remove that user from the friends of the currently authenticated user.

        If the provided username does not match a user that is an existing friend of the authenticated user, a ResourceNotFoundException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        friendUsername - the String username of the user to remove from friends
        Returns:
        the newly modified User object
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the user with the given username is not an existing friend
